sen.j: すり鉢（すりばち、擂り鉢）とは、食材を細かな粒子状に砕いたり、ペースト状にすりつぶす加工を行うための調理器具である。
sen.e: The term "Suribachi (mortar)" refers to a cookware to grind food materials into small grain or to mash up into paste.
The term "Suribachi (mortar)" refers to cookware which grinds food materials into small grains or mashes them up into paste.
The term "Suribachi" (mortar) refers to cookware that is used to grind food materials into small grains or mash them up into paste.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 形状は「すり鉢状」という言葉があるように、円錐を逆にしたような形で、下がすぼまり上に行くほど径が大きくなる。
sen.e: As the word 'suribachijo (shape of suribachi)' shows, it has an inverted shape of circular cone, which is narrow at one end, has sloping sides, and is round at the other end.
As the word 'suribachijo (shape of suribachi)' shows, it is shaped as an inverted shape circular cone, which is narrow at one end, has sloping sides, and is round at the other end.
As the word 'suribachijo' (shape of suribachi) shows, it is shaped like an inverted circular cone, which is narrow at one end, has sloping sides, and is round at the other end.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 鉢の内側には櫛目（放射状の縦の溝）が付けられており、溝に食材が引っかかるために、少ない力で効率よくすりつぶせる。
sen.e: It has kushime (radial stripe groove) inside of the morter, which makes it possible to grind food materials efficiently with a small power.
It has kushime (radial stripe groove) inside of the morter, which makes it possible to grind food materials efficiently requiring little power.
It has kushime (radial ridged pattern) inside of the mortar, which makes it possible to grind food materials efficiently requiring a little power.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 棒状のすりこぎと対で使われ、すり鉢の内側にこすり付けるようにすりこぎを左に回して材料をすりつぶして行く。
sen.e: It is used together with a rod-shaped pestle, and food materials are ground by turning the pestle to the left as if rubbing them against the inside of the Suribachi.
It is used together with a rod-shaped pestle, and food materials are ground by turning the pestle to the left as if rubbing them against the inside of the Suribachi.
It is used together with a rod-shaped pestle, and food materials are ground by rotating the pestle to the left as if rubbing them against the inside of the Suribachi.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: なお、「する」という言葉が博打や商売で「お金をする」につながるとの語呂合わせから、縁起をかついであたり鉢、あたり棒と呼ばれることも多い。
sen.e: In addition, since the word 'Suru' is considered to lead to the word 'drop money' in gamble or business in a play on words, it is often called Ataribachi (a hit bowl) or Ataribo (a hit stick) for good luck as well.

In addition, since the word 'Suru' is a play on words which refers to the word 'drop money' which is found in the gambling and business world, it is often called Ataribachi (a hit bowl) or Ataribo (a hit stick) for good luck as well.

In addition, since the word 'Suru' is a word play which refers to the word 'drop money' which is found in the gambling and business world, it is often called Ataribachi (a hit bowl) or Ataribo (a hit stick) for good luck as well.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: そのためすり鉢でする行為をあたると表現する事もある。
sen.e: Therefore, the action to grind in Suribachi is sometimes expressed a hit.
Therefore, the action to grind in Suribachi sometimes expresses a hit or stroke of luck.
Therefore, the action to grind in Suribachi is sometimes expressed a hit or stroke of luck.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: すり鉢の大きさは寸（または号）で表される。
sen.e: The size of Suribachi is shown by sun (= 3.03 cm) (or go (a kind of ranking)).
The size of Suribachi is measured in sun (= 3.03 cm) (or go (a kind of ranking)).
The size of Suribachi is expressed using 'sun' (= 3.03 cm) (or go (a kind of ranking)).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 目安としては、7寸で1～2人用、8寸で3～4人用、9寸で5～6人用である。
sen.e: As a guide, the seven sun Suribachi is for one or two persons, the eight sun is for three or four, and the nine sun is for five to six.
Normally, a seven sun Suribachi is for one or two persons, an eight sun is for three or four, and a nine sun is for five to six.
Generally, a seven sun Suribachi is for one or two persons, an eight sun is for three or four, and a nine sun is for five to six.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: すり鉢は、一般的に大きめの方が使い勝手が良いといわれている。
sen.e: It is generally said that the larger Suribachi is easier to use.
It is generally said that the larger Suribachi is easier to use.
It is generally said that a larger Suribachi is easier to use.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: すり鉢は、狭義には上記に示した日本独自の調理器具であるが、広義には日本以外で利用されている同様の目的をもった調理器具も便宜上すり鉢と呼ぶことがある。
sen.e: In a narrow sense Suribachi is a unique cookware of Japan as mentioned above, but in a broad sense the other cookware which is used for the same purpose in other countries is also called Suribachi in some cases.

In a narrow sense Suribachi cookware unique to Japan as mentioned above, but in a broader sense, other cookware which are used for the same purpose in other countries are also called Suribachi in some cases.

In a narrow sense, Suribachi cookware is unique to Japan as mentioned above, but in a broader sense, other cookware which are used for the same purpose in other countries are also called Suribachi in some cases.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: すり鉢の生産史
sen.e: The history of production of Suribachi
The history of Suribachi production
The history of Suribachi production

sen.j: すり(擂)鉢が最初に登場したのは、鎌倉時代中葉から後半、すなわち、13世紀末～14世紀初頭頃で、備前焼の窯（グイビ谷窯、熊山山頂9号窯など）で発見されている。
sen.e: The first Suribachi in history appeared from the middle to the latter part of the Kamakura period, that is, from the end of the thirteenth centuries to the beginning of the fourteenth centuries, which was seen in the kiln of Bizen yaki (Bizen ware)(such as Guibidani gama (kiln) and Kumayama sancho 9go gama (No.9 kiln at the summit of Mt. kuma)).

The first Suribachi in history appeared from the middle to the latter part of the Kamakura period, that is, from the end of the thirteenth centuries to the beginning of the fourteenth centuries, which was seen in the kiln of Bizen yaki (Bizen ware)(such as Guibidani gama (kiln) and Kumayama sancho 9go gama (No.9 kiln at the summit of Mt. kuma)).

The first Suribachi in history appeared from the middle to the latter part of the Kamakura period, that is, from the end of the thirteenth century to the beginning of the fourteenth century, and was discovered in the kiln of Bizen yaki (Bizen ware) (such as Guibidani gama (kiln) and Kumayama sancho 9-go gama (No.9 kiln at the summit of Mt. kuma)).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 16世紀頃から口縁部に縁帯をもつすり鉢が生産され、擂り目も隙間を埋め尽くすように施されるようになる。
sen.e: Since around sixteenth centuries Suribachi with an edge belt at the rim began to be produced and the groove was also added as if filling up the gap.
Since around the sixteenth century, Suribachi began to be produced with an edge belt at the rim and the groove was also added as if to fill the gap.
sen.cmt: Edited for flowRobert: What is "edge belt"
sen.e: Since around the sixteenth century, Suribachi began to be produced with an edge belt at the rim and the ridged pattern was also added as if to fill the gap.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 「備前すり鉢投げても割れぬ」と称され関西方面では他の器種とともに圧倒的なシェアを誇った。
sen.e: It is said that 'Bizen Suribachi can not be broken even if it is thrown,' and it dominated the market with other plateware in the Kansai region.
It is said that 'Bizen Suribachi can not be broken even if it is thrown,' and it dominated the market with other plateware in the Kansai region.
It is said that 'Bizen Suribachi cannot be broken even if it is thrown,' and it dominated the market with other potteries in the Kansai region.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 備前のすり鉢を横から見た形状は底部から丸く立ちあがるので、半球形に近い。
sen.e: The Suribachi of Bizen has a round shape from the bottom, seen from the side, which is near to hemisphere.
The Suribachi of Bizen has a round shape from the bottom, when viewed from the side, and is almost chaped like a half sphere.
The Suribachi of Bizen has a round shape from the bottom, when viewed from the side, and is almost shaped like a half sphere.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 信楽焼の窯では、15世紀初頭の五位ノ木窯で擂り目が1条1単位のものが出現し、15世紀中葉から後半頃の長野3号窯や東出窯で擂り目4条1単位のすり鉢が出現する。
sen.e: In the kiln of Shigaraki yaki (Shigaraki ware), the Suribachi with one groove in one unit appeared in the Goinoki gama (kiln) of the beginning of the fifteenth centuries, and the Suribachi with four grooves in one unit appeared in Nagano No.3 kiln and Higashide gama (kiln) from the middle to the latter part of the fifteenth centuries.

In the kiln of Shigaraki yaki (Shigaraki ware), Suribachi with a single groove in one unit appeared in the Goinoki gama (kiln) at the beginning of the fifteenth century, and Suribachi with four grooves in a single unit appeared in Nagano No.3 kiln and Higashide gama (kiln) from the middle to the latter part of the fifteenth century.

In the kiln of Shigaraki yaki (Shigaraki ware), Suribachi with a single ridged pattern in one unit appeared in the Goinoki gama (kiln) at the beginning of the fifteenth century, and Suribachi with four ridged patterns in a single unit appeared in Nagano No.3 kiln and Higashide gama (kiln) from the middle to the latter part of the fifteenth century.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 16世紀後半になると7本1単位の擂り目を隙間を埋め尽くすかのように施すようになる。
sen.e: In the latter part of the sixteenth centuries, the seven grooves in one unit became to be adopted as if filling up the gap.
In the latter part of the sixteenth century, the model which used seven grooves in a single unit was adopted as if to fill the gap between the grooves.
In the latter part of the sixteenth century, the model that used seven ridged patterns in a single unit was adopted as if to fill the gap between the ridged patterns.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 瀬戸焼では、15世紀前半から中葉ころ（古瀬戸様式後期様式）の窯で擂り目6本1単位のすり鉢が生産され始める。
sen.e: In the Seto-yaki (Seto ware), the Suribachi with six grooves in one unit began to be produced in the kiln from the early to the middle of the fifteen centuries (the kiln in the latter style of old Seto style).

In the Seto-yaki (Seto ware),Suribachi with six grooves in one unit began to be produced in the kiln from the early to the middle of the fifteenth century (the kiln in the latter style of old Seto style).

In the Seto-yaki (Seto ware), Suribachi with six ridged patterns in a single unit began to be produced in a kiln from the early to the middle of the fifteenth century (the kiln in the latter style of old Seto style).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: その後15世紀末に10～12本1単位の擂り目を10～12方向に放射状に施すすり鉢が出現し、16世紀の大窯期にさらに擂り目をぎっしりと施すようになる。
sen.e: After that, in the fifteenth centuries, the Suribachi with from ten to twelve grooves in one unit which are shaped in the ten to twelve directions appeared, and in the sixteenth centuries when big kilns were used, the more grooves became to be shaped closely.

After the fifteenth century, Suribachi with ten to twelve grooves in one unit which are shaped in ten to twelve directions appeared, and in the sixteenth centuries when big kilns were used, and grooves came to be shaped more closely.

At the end of the fifteenth century, Suribachi with ten to twelve ridged patterns in a single unit, shaped radially in ten to twelve directions, appeared, and in the sixteenth century when big kilns were used, ridged patterns came to be shaped more closely.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 横からみた形状は富士山を逆さにして潰したような円錐状である。
sen.e: Its shape seen from the side looks like a cone as if Mt.Fuji is inverted and its top is destroyed.
From the side, its shape looks as if Mt.Fuji was inverted and its top was destroyed.
When seen from the side, its shape looks as if Mt. Fuji was inverted and its top was destroyed.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: このほか越前焼でもすり鉢が少なくとも室町時代から生産されており、丹波焼については、14世紀中葉から後半にかけての時期に1条1単位のものが現れる。
sen.e: Besides, in the Echizen-yaki (Echizen ware) kiln, Suribachi has been also produced since at least Muromachi period, and in the Tanba-yaki (Tanba ware) kiln, the Suribachi with one groove in one unit appeared from the middle to the latter part of the fourteenth centuries.

Besides, in the Echizen-yaki (Echizen ware) kiln, Suribachi was also produced since at least Muromachi period, and in the Tanba-yaki (Tanba ware) kiln, the Suribachi with one groove in one unit appeared from the middle to the latter part of the fourteenth centry.

Additionally, in the Echizen-yaki (Echizen ware) kiln, Suribachi were also produced from at least the Muromachi period, and in the Tanba-yaki (Tanba ware) kiln, Suribachi having one ridged pattern in a single unit appeared from the middle to the latter part of the fourteenth century.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 焼き締め陶で丈夫であることから江戸時代前半(17世紀)にはまたたくまに関東までのシェアを誇った。
sen.e: Since it was produced in yakishime (pottery that is fired without any applied glaze) method and tough, it dominated the markets including Kanto region in the early Edo period (the seventeenth centuries).

Since it was produced using the yakishime (pottery that is fired without any applied glaze) method and was tough, it dominated the markets up to the Kanto region in the early Edo period (the seventeenth centuries).

Since it was produced using the yakishime (pottery that is fired without any applied glaze) method and was tough, it dominated the markets over to the Kanto region in the early Edo period (the seventeenth centuries).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、18世紀になると、備前を模倣し半球形を呈する堺産のすり鉢に東日本のシェアを奪われてしまう。
sen.e: However, in the eighteenth centuries, the Suribachi made in Sakai with a hemisphere shape which imitated the Suribachi of Bizen derived the share of the East Japan.
However, in the eighteenth century, the Suribachi made in Sakai with a hemisphere shape which imitated the Suribachi of Bizen grabbed the majority share.
However, in the eighteenth century, Suribachi made in Sakai, which had a semi-spherical shape and that imitated the Suribachi of Bizen, grabbed the majority share in eastern Japan.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 以後、堺産は、その堅牢さから徐々に東日本で瀬戸美濃産のすり鉢も圧倒し、明治時代までその傾向が続く。
sen.e: After that, the Suribachi made in Sakai had gradually blown out the one made in Seto and Mino because of it toughness until the Meiji period.
After that, the Suribachi made in Sakai gradually steamrolled those made in Seto and Mino due to its durability, until the end of the Meiji period.
After that, the Suribachi made in Sakai gradually overwhelm those made in Seto and Mino due to its durability, until the end of the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 常滑焼については中世を通じて捏ね鉢しか生産されなかった。
sen.e: In the Tokoname yaki (Tokoname ware) kiln, only mixing bowl was produced during the medieval period.
In the Tokoname yaki (Tokoname ware) kiln, only mixing bowls were produced during the medieval period.
In the Tokoname-yaki (Tokoname ware) kiln, only kneading bowls were produced during the medieval period.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: また15～17世紀にかけて、瓦質土器と呼ばれるもろい土器のすり鉢が生産されている
sen.e: In addition, from the fifteenth to the seventeenth centuries, the Suribachi of soft earthware called gashitsu doki (earthenware) had been produced.
In addition, from the fifteenth to the seventeenth century, Suribachi created from soft earthware called gashitsu doki (earthenware) were produced.
In addition, from the fifteenth to the seventeenth century, Suribachi created from soft earthenware called gashitsu doki (earthenware) were produced.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: すり鉢は、口縁部の変化や擂り目の量の変化（新しくなるにつれて擂り目が増える）が著しい遺物であるため、考古学において遺跡の年代を決める編年の資料に使われることがある。
sen.e: Suribachi is sometimes used as a material to decide the period of ruin in archaeology since its rim and the depth of the groove change greatly during usage (a newer Suribachi has more grooves).
Suribachi is sometimes used as a material to decide age of ruins in archaeology since its rim and depth of the groove change greatly according to its usage (a newer Suribachi has more grooves).
Suribachi is sometimes used to date ruins in archaeology since its rim and number of ridged patterns change greatly according to its usage (a newer Suribachi has more ridged patterns).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

Shiraae (tofu and vegetables in a sesame sauce)
Shiraae (tofu and vegetables in a sesame sauce)

sen.j: 胡麻豆腐
sen.e: Goma-dofu (crushed sesame seeds boiled in water and chilled like tofu)
Goma-dofu (crushed sesame seeds boiled in water and chilled like tofu)
Goma-dofu (crushed sesame seeds boiled in water and chilled like tofu)
